other_tests.findings: The biopsy of the right side of the heart did not reveal a cause of the heart failure.
Showed late-appearing bubbles on the left side of the heart, consistent with an intrapulmonary shunt.
The patient was heterozygous for a mutation in ACVRL1, considered to be causative of hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia.
Revealed atrial fibrillation, frequent premature ventricular contractions, ST-segment depression of at least 1 mm in leads II, III, and aVF, and downsloping ST-segment depression of 2 mm in lead V6.
